reviews.sentence: Did not disappoint. Stayed 4 days for the Gramy awards. The Polo Lounge was a lot of fun. The service was flawless. When it comes to comfort atmosphere and hospitality this is certainly in my world top 10 and my US top 5.

Amazing Hotel Superb Service. My husband and I stayed at The Beverly Hills Hotel in May for our anniversary celebration. It was very relaxing and comfortable and the service was superb. We stayed in the main building and although the room was small it was recently remodeled and very nice. My husband liked all the high tech upgrades. We loved The Polo Lounge. You can dine on the patio or inside under the green and white stripes. The Fountain Coffee Room is another great choice with old fashioned counter seating. Sandwiches salads and delicious looking desserts etc. are served. It was a fun place. The grounds are lush and green filled with palm trees. A lovely arbor leads down to the pool. The Cabana Café is there for polside drinks or dining. The hotel is minutes from Rodeo Drive Hollywood and West Hollywood. It is about 45 minutes to Malibu and 30 minutes to Santa Monica for ocean beaches. The Beverly Hills Hotel is an outstanding hotel with an amazing friendly staff.

Beautiful. This hotel is beautiful both inside and out its lavish rooms and beautiful hallways are all so stunning. The pool is amazing and huge from most other hotels in its surrounding areas but unfortunately it was too cold outside to even enjoy it. The bungalows are so secluded and truly gives it a private atmosphere. The Beverly Hills Hotel is truly one of LAs Beverly Hills crown jewels. Thank you for the amazing time see you again next summer.

hollywood history just had to stay here. We were on a trip organised to celebrate our 25th wedding aniversary. After our long trans atlantic trip we were tired and needed some 5 star pampering. We just had to stay at the Beverlyhils hotel. It is one for the bucket list. The hotel is nestled just off Sunset Boulevard and as soon as you ascend it is driveway you start to relax. The entrance to the foyer has been photographed a million times and we like the thousands before us just had to get a snap taken at the hotels entrance. You feel very special entering this hotel as it is steeped in so much hollywood history. the front desk staff were wonderful they had upgraded our room and supplied a chilled bottle of champagne I am sure our travek agent tipped them ofour room was large sumpteous with a private patio area. every comfort is here. On our 3 day stop over we made a point of eating in the legendary Polo Lounge. The service was perfect the food rich but lovely. the atmosphere was also great. when you decide to stay at such a prestiges hotel you can not worry about the price For those who want to know a two course meal for my wife and I including a 20 tip cocktails and a bottle of wine came to 410. we would pay it again just to have experienced this lounge. The weather in Los angeles was not great when we were there so we did not have the opertunity to sit by the pool. We used our time visit the cities sights and also to do a little shopping. In the evening we just relaxed in our room or patio. This hotel is a must visit place. we can now say that we have been here and know what it is all about. the sevice is amazing the rooms are perfect. all in this palce is 5 star with the added bonus of hollywood history.

Home from Home. I have not been back to The Beverley Hills Hotel for a good few years and just returned. Its exactly the same and that is a great achievement. Firstly what is so good is the exquisite service very friendly and very professional. The rooms are great and overall I love it and recommend a stay here anytime.

Great Hotel. Definitely top notch and worth it. We had a great time while staying at this hotel. The Polo Lounge had a nice atmosphere and the waygu steak was wonderful. Staff was very attentive and loved the valet vehicle that provided us rides to and from the shopping.

Classic luxury hotel with the best service I have ever experienced. From the moment of arrival to check out following my two night stay the staff at The Beverly Hills Hotel are second to none. The front desk agent walked me to my room explaining the hotels rich history to me as we walked. She also provided me an exhaustive list of the rooms amenities and how to use them. The room was immaculately clean spacious and afforded views of the hotels courtyard. Housekeeping was quick and allowed me to choose the time at which they would clean the room an added perk for someone traveling on business. What is perhaps most striking about this hotel is the professionalism of every employee I encountered. They all knew me by name and would greet me at all times when I was in public spaces. I was also given a late check out of 20pm on my day of departure well after the 120pm check out time. This hotel is a must if staying in LA for at least two nights as one night is simply not enough time to enjoy the high quality service this hotel offers. This is simply one of the best hotels I have ever had the privilege of staying at.
Attended a Christmas party ballroom is beautiful and the hotel staff was friendly and extremely helpful.

Lovely excellent service. Great rooms service so excellent you can easily flow thru the property with no problems. QUIET rooms even better. The Restaurants Spa pool facilities are all A. Truly have earned the respect as well as excellent reputation that they have in the area.

Love the mystik and history of this place and they let us park our motorcycles in the garage right next to a lot of very famous peoples vehicles. That was cool. The food and staff were really cordial and amazing. An unforgettable experience for brunch.

GROSS 0 Stars. First of all this hotel needs a major renovation. Carpet in my room was dirty and stained mold smell horrible service at pool. Rude staff. Overpriced. Major engineering flaws. In my option this hotel needs to be torn down and rebuilt. Very loud. Horrible service at pool. Worst cabana boys ever. I feel ripped off. The rooms should be 200 a night. Seriously. It felt gross.

The valet staff outside is highly unprofessional to say the least. it is ok to be courteous to a ride share driver even if you are not making tips off of them. Just because you are in a specialmod does not give you the right to be condescending disrespectful and prejudice. On a lighter note if your employer is a muslim I think you have lost the right to act be a racist bigot. I wish HR is more selective hiring the first faces customers see when they firs get to the establishment.

Stayed here at the beginning of July for 2 nights and not impressed. Hotel has no ambience it is like a ghost town. Staff was friendly but upon arrival I was in shock that such a well known establishment has no music or any type of character. Yes it is a famous hotel and that is the only thing they can milk out of it. The lobby smells like a funeral home and has no wow factor for the price. It really smells like an old grandmas house. With what they charge they can afford a nice sound system with great aromatherapy. The only thing I actually liked was the Fountain Cafe. Best tuna melt.

nice hotel but with a bit disappointment. It is a small hotel but with spacious rooms indeed. On the first day after entering the room what ‘ surprise ’ me was that there was a cleaning sponge left on the basin in the bathroom and several scrap paper under the writing table. Hey it ’s the Beverly hill hotel can you imagine that. We had the dinner and breakfast in the hotel restaurant which was with good service but I have to say the food was way too salty. Even the kids pizza was very salty and my daughter was keeping drinking apple juice and water during the dinner time. For me it ’s not a perfect hotel but staying at the pink palace was a special experience for me and we had a wonderful holiday in LA tho.

Listen to these reviews stay away from this hotel. I ca n’t even explain how bad the rooms were in the Oasis tower. I was willing to shell out 70 dollars above my room rate just to get in to the other tower but they could n’t accommodate two rooms which seemed ridiculous. I left the hotel and went somewhere else much nicer and much pricier. Also I chose to prepay one room because it was for my sisters 50th and I did n’t want her trying to pay but they would n’t refund me that money because I prepaid by choice which seemed ridiculous but I just wanted out. I spent a lot of time at the front desk even that was dirty and gross.
The cafe is a fun and yummy local spot with a cool dinner vibe. A latte is 11 a 2 item omelette is approximately 28 validated valet 10. costly but good.

Front desk Staff is EXTREMELY rude. I called one month in advance to book a garden room with a view for myself and my fiancée and they showed us to a basement room facing Sunset Blvd and simply said “ that ’s all we have tonight ”. No apology was made for not honoring our booking. The room was over 1000 night and very load AND dirty. We opened the mini bar and a water bottle inside was open and half drunk. Disgusting. I called the fro t desk and the concierge laughed and said he would send someone up to change the bottle but nobody ever came. Dinner was expensive and disappointing. The soup was stone cold when it arrived. Do not stay in this hotel for a special occasion. There are so many other choices and you can do so much better than the horrible Beverly Hills Hotel.

Nostaglic. A nostalgic location with great history. Beautiful facilities. Polo Lounge was amazing. Wasn’t sound proof. Could hear kids jumping around on floor above us. The systems went down just upon our arrival. We were compensated with breakfast for the inconvenience however after our stay a double charge had incurred on our credit card. Also site said to consult wit Pepe for prime dining seating but he was n’t available and no one else seemed to have his knowledge.

Decadent old school luxury. A rocky start to this old school celebrity hangout brought initial disappointment. After arriving from LAX and being reprimanded by some jumped up older car parking valet guy for turning in the wrong direction who I snapped on. did n’t help. The ever increasing second mortgage busting breakfast menu that followed also left me feeling short changed to say the least. All this became insignificant when as if by magic a few discrete comments made in passing to the professorial and attentive staff who had witnessed my negative demeanour were acted on. The head bellboy apologised let me park where I preferred cold water slipped in the Mustang every morning cheers brother Back in the restaurant David Mutter. had also worked his magic with Pepe because the next morning everything had changed. A exceptional relaxing stay. If staying in cabanas where Hollywood directors invented movies Having Marilyn Monroe ’s favourite bungalow as a option and Harrison Ford walking past you at the pool floats your boat then this is still the original top dog hotel in the area. We personally do n’t get too starstruck which is why the varied clientele like the Kardashian ’s Simon Cowel etc probably feel so at ease. As long as the staff continue to keep it real and the management keep providing a complimentary chauffeur driven Cadilacs down to Rodeo drive then we ’l no doubt continue to revisit this seventh wonder of the world.

AWESOME. I lived in Los Angeles area over fifty years ago and although I was sure I had been to the Beverly Hills Hotel I guess I was mistaken. When I walked into the lobby last Saturday to meet very good friends for a birthday luncheon in the Polo Lounge I thought I had stepped back to the early 60’s. What a beautiful establishment and the restaurant had a certain vibei loved the look and the food was delicious. I hope to go back there soon as I do n’t have another half century to wait.

I ’ve had better brunches. Fancy hotel fancy cafe nice decor great staff and service. However brunch food could have been nicer. I had the smashed avo poached eggs with salad. Salad was dry and and not fresh. Presentation of food was standard. For what you pay I do n’t think it was good value. I do n’t mind paying for good food felt it was basic and did n’t live up to the great name. Just my opinion on one visit.

One of the greatest hotels in the world. Los Angeles is a large city like area surrounding the Beverly Hills Hotel Fran LebowitzThat about sums it up. They have done an amazing job maintaining the history of this hotel while keeping the hotel fresh and modern. All that and the best service we have ever received across 4 continents just fabulous. I first read about this hotel as a child in a drab Irish housing estate in the 1970s. I imagined it to be an almost heavenly place of colour glamour and excess and 45 years later I made it there and it exceed all my expectations. Just sitting in the garden sipping a coffee and listening to the birdsong is worth the room rate. We had a deluxe room with balcony and I do recommend going for a room with outdoor space to take advantage of the great climate. You must have the chocolate souffle. I was very naughty and had one delivered every night as a bedtime snack and the McCarthy salad. The bar is so nice with great views and less well known and therefore quieter than the other areas of the hotel. Ask them to make you the cocktail from their sister hotel The Bel Air Monroes Passion. One piece of feedback for management your website is very pretty and creates the right mood but you need better pictures of the rooms. The suites have great pictures and floor plans but it is not easy to pick a room category with the lack of pictures. We will be back in 2020 looking at the bungalow room vs bungalow room with patio on the website and none the wiser as to what we might expect or if the patio room is worth the rate.
